snippet: Public space, even a modest and chaotic swath of it like Taksim Square, again reveals itself as fundamentally more powerful than social media.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook column holds that Taksim Square in Istanbul is the latest reminder of the power of public space; square has become arena for clashing worldviews of unyielding leader’s top-down, neo-Ottoman, conservative vision of the nation versus bottom-up, pluralist, disordered, primarily young, less Islamist vision of Turkey as modern democracy.
lead_paragraph: Public space, even a modest and chaotic swath of it like Taksim Square, again reveals itself as fundamentally more powerful than social media.

headline.print_headline: In Istanbul’s Heart, Leader’s Obsession, Perhaps Achilles’ Heel
headline.seo: In Istanbul’s Taksim Square, an Achilles’ Heel
headline.main: In Istanbul’s Heart, Leader’s Obsession, Perhaps Achilles’ Heel
